required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Investigation of the Effects of a Oral Hygiene Regimen in Irregular Flossers on Gingivitis and Plaque

lead_sponsor.agency: Tufts University School of Dental Medicine

clinical_study.source: Tufts University School of Dental Medicine

brief_summary.textblock:
In the current study, Sonicare AirFloss (AF) will be used in combination with a Manual Toothbrush (MTB) in a population of manual toothbrush users who are irregular flossers and who exhibit signs of moderate gingivitis. The alternate test arm will be allocated to a No Intervention group and will be given no test products or instruction other than to change none of their typical at home oral hygiene habits.
The aim of this study is to investigate how an AF and MTB oral hygiene intervention will affect a population of irregular flossers using the residual protein concentration method as an interproximal plaque efficacy assessment. Gingivitis reduction will be assessed using the Modified Gingival Index (MGI) and Gingival Bleeding Index (GBI) indices

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study terminated by sponsor due to low accrual, and high number of protocol deviations due in part to the impact of Hurricane Sandy on protocol compliance.

primary_outcome.measure: The Effect of Sonicare AirFloss + MTB Treatment Versus the Control Group
primary_outcome.description: The primary objective of the study is to compare the effect of Sonicare AirFloss + MTB treatment versus the Control Group on gingival inflammation (as measure by number of bleeding sites, and reduction in MGI) after four weeks of use.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the effect of the Sonicare AirFloss + MTB treatment on gingival inflammation as measured after 2 and 4 weeks versus baseline.
Compare the number of bleeding sites in Modified Gingival Index following 2 weeks of use of the Sonicare AirFloss + Manual Toothbrush versus the Control Group.
Compare plaque as measured by the reduction and percent reduction in Residual Protein Concentration (RPC) following 2 and 4 weeks of use of the Sonicare AirFloss + MTB and Control Group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the safety of the Sonicare AirFloss + MTB treatment.
Compare the percentage of bleeding sites in Modified Gingival Index following 2 weeks of use of the Sonicare AirFloss + Manual Toothbrush versus the Control Group.

facility.name: Tufts University School of Dental Medicine

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 257 subjects who signed consent forms, 140 (54.5% were classified as screen failures). 1 additional subject declined to participate after screening but before randomization.

baseline.population: Data cannot be provided for each arm separately, but only in aggregate

group.title: All Randomized Subjects
group.description: The study was terminated early, data were not analyzed and the plaque samples were destroyed. Data cannot be provided for each arm separately, but only in aggregate.

measure.title: Average Modified Gingival Index Score

outcome.description: Evaluate the effect of the Sonicare AirFloss + MTB treatment on gingival inflammation as measured after 2 and 4 weeks versus baseline.

outcome.description: Compare plaque as measured by the reduction and percent reduction in Residual Protein Concentration (RPC) following 2 and 4 weeks of use of the Sonicare AirFloss + MTB and Control Group.

outcome.description: Assess the safety of the Sonicare AirFloss + MTB treatment.

outcome.description: Compare the percentage of bleeding sites in Modified Gingival Index following 2 weeks of use of the Sonicare AirFloss + Manual Toothbrush versus the Control Group.

group.title: All Randomized Subjects
group.description: Summary of AEs for All Randomized Subjects

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Terminated by sponsor due to: Changes in business strategy/Target completion dates not being met Higher than anticipated screen failure rate Higher than anticipated early termination rate Large number of protocol deviations encountered
